title: Your chance to Chase What Matters
author: Yankeefan51

posts.post_title: Your chance to Chase What Matters
posts.post_content:
A $10,000 bill bears the face of Samuel Chase...
$10,000 can be your if you can sell or trade us
a select group of high grade rare type cards
from the list below.  All transactions must be
completed by August 2, 2010

Thanks,

Bruce Dorskind
[url]bdorskind@dorskindgroup.com[/url]


   America’s Toughest Want List
ItemCatalog #     Condition
Clements Brothers  D-3805+
WilliamsE 1036+
Texas Tommy  E 224 (type I) 5+
Texas Tommy   E 225 (type 2)
Tip Top Baltimore4+
Philadelphia Caramel   E-967+
Bishop Team Cards   E 221
G&B Gum  E 221 (photo)6
Darby Chocolates  E 271 (box)NA
Holland Creameries (1924)5
Crowly Milk- 19406
Western Playground    H-9985
Baltimore News (1914)5
Lections  (1923)5
Ullman PC (1906)5
Winthrop Moving Pictures  PC (1906)5
Brush Automotive PC (1908)
Rose Post Card  PC 7608
Schmelzer’s Sporting Goods (1912-pin)      6
FiresideT-2085+
Contentea T 209-1 (Four Color) 7+

[quote name="Yankeefan51" post=824887]A $10,000 bill bears the face of Samuel Chase...[/QUOTE]


I believe you meant Salmon P. Chase, NOT Samuel Chase. (At least that't what they taught us at the community college!)
However Samuel Chase is the only US Supreme Court Justice to have been impeached. He was found "Not Guilty" and returned to the bench. 

(Out of politeness, I won't bother correcting the other, duplicated BST posts, but feel free to correct them all.)
Jim VB can cut to the chase like no other.
Maybe he meant vinnie chase , star of huge hits aquaman, head on and gatsby

[quote name="BigDan502" post=824913]Maybe he meant vinnie chase , star of huge hits aquaman, head on and gatsby[/QUOTE]

Don't forget that new Ferrari movie. Maybe he meant johnny chase--the  other chase brother.

Maybe he just meant 'The Chase' that terrible movie with Charlie sheen and kristy Swanson. 

Or how about hal chase? Can we get a pink background on that 10000 dollar bill?
Jim- I finally figured out why you said I was late on the other thread. Didn't realize Bruce posted this same list three times. Now it makes sense.
While you all were correcting Bruce's posts, I just closed 43 deals on impossibly high grade pre-war cards.

[quote name="Matt" post=825043]While you all were correcting Bruce's posts, I just closed 43 deals on impossibly high grade pre-war cards.[/QUOTE]

And now let me correct yours.
Change ""while" to "whilst".
Change "I" to "we".
:D

[quote name="Peter_Spaeth" post=825048]And now let me correct yours.
Change ""while" to "whilst".
Change "I" to "we".
:D[/QUOTE]

If it was "we," he could have closed 86 or even 129 deals. Alas, Matt is just "I."


(And for the record, Bruce gets EXACTLY, what he wants, as we, continuously, bump his thread.)

Whilst, you, your fellow low-life red necks and other "sorted" followers
would not know or appreciate an ultra rare high grade card if you fell on it,
we take comfort in knowing that you are probably consuming high grade
spam... 

Keep firing Jim- your hot air does nothing except add to the hot, dirty air which emanates from the poison gas that you spew


Bruce Dorskind
America's Toughest Want List

[quote name="barrysloate" post=825082]Tough crowd.[/QUOTE]

Exactly what I was thinking :rolleyes:

:rolleyes:


It's "sordid" you moron, not "sorted." And they're not "followers." They are "henchmen."


Edited to add: I used to be greatly concerned about the state of public education in this country. While that hasn't eased much, I am growing increasingly fearful of the failures of the Ivy League. 

Matt, please say something smart to make me feel better!

[quote name="Jim VB" post=825087]
Edited to add: I used to be greatly concerned about the state of public education in this country. While that hasn't eased much, I am growing increasingly fearful of the failures of the Ivy League. 

Matt, please say something smart to make me feel better![/QUOTE]

Jim -I wasn't tenured at Wharton like Bruce were.  Something happens to your IQ once you get tenured.

In all seriousness, I'm confident the education one receives in the Ivys is the same as that received from public universities.  The two key differences from my point of view are that it looks good on my resume and that I've got a network of friends who also have it looking good on their resumes.

[quote name="Matt" post=825097]Jim -I wasn't tenured at Wharton like Bruce were.  Something happens to your IQ once you get tenured.

In all seriousness, I'm confident the education one receives in the Ivys is the same as that received from public universities.  The two key differences from my point of view are that it looks good on my resume and that I've got a network of friends who also have it looking good on their resumes.[/QUOTE]

I was tenured at an Ivy League college (which one doesn't matter), however, I still have faith in the education system of today.  Many would say (including my wife) that something DID happen once I was tenured, it went down :eek: 

With that being said, it hasn't changed my opinion or love for the hobby (somehow related to why my wife feels my IQ has dropped when I start talking about "baseball cards", but someday she will come around, hopefully) :D.

Jim,

Bush went to Yale and Obama to Harvard, feel better?  :D
